title: Criminal Behavior (2013)
overview: A young couple, Nathan and Jewel, are enduring financial and emotional hardship, when past criminal friends re-emerge into their lives and force Nathan to partake in a robbery. Now, he must find a way to stop his past from destroying his future.  Written and directed by Warren Pemberton
storyline: A young couple, Nathan and Jewel, are enduring financial and emotional hardship, when past criminal friends re-emerge into their lives and force Nathan to partake in a robbery. Now, he must find a way to stop his past from destroying his future.
synopsis: Nathan (Usman Sharif) and Jewel (Verina Banks), a young couple, are enduring financial and emotional hardships. Since Jewel's recent unemployment, Nathan has found himself baring the financial brunt and to make matters worse, Jewel's Pregnant. Since their car was stolen, He takes the transit home late at night and has become increasingly moody thus blaming her for their situation. During such an argument, they hear a noise and Nathan pulls a gun from the closet resulting in another fight about having a weapon in the house. Unable to reach a compromise, they sleep apart. Nathan's place of employment is a food distribution warehouse. It's hard blue-collar work, but he's a good employee and well liked by his boss, Cedric (Clifton Powell) and co-worker, Anthony (Killer Mike). While walking home, he's followed by a car full of criminal friends from his past, Darrell (Sharieff Pugh), the thuggish leader, Isaac (Kibwe Miller), the follower and Tank (Bryant Pearson), the muscle. They give Nathan a ride home, influencing him to partake in their intoxicants, as they plea for a couple nights stay at his place. Since Nathan pays the bills, he feels more controlling and over-rules Jewel's dismay of his guests. His intoxication has made him unreasonable and auspicious of his friends' behavior. Jewel watches helplessly as her boyfriend reminisces with his old friends, drinking and smoking. Tank tries to be-friend Jewel by cooking her breakfast, being nice and courteous until she eventually warms to her new guests. Although Nathan's friends charm Jewel's worries away temporarily, their criminal behavior is confirmed, when she discovers that they are indeed fugitives. Instead of fleeing, they force their old partner to partake in a robbery by threatening his fiancée's life. Knowing his partners will likely kill them afterwards; he must now find a way to stop his past from destroying his future.
